page.title: 10TOMATOES:SHELLEY NURSERY
page.content: The glasshouse at Shelley Nursery, Wigley is used for tomatoes.5 tomato plants are grown in each peat bag and watered 4 times a day by drip pipes leading to each plant.They are planted in November and picked up to the middle of the following October.There are then only 2 weeks to clear the glasshouse and plant the next season's tomatoes.The plants grow to 30 feet long with an expected yield of 115 tons per acre. Tomatoes can get Potrytis and Red Spider Mite,which are treated.White fly attacks tomatoes and is killed off by Ichneumen wasps,which lay their eggs in the fly eggs. The tomatoes used to be sold in certain sizes,and a grading machine was used.Now ungraded tomatoes are sold in 30 lb crates for supermarket sales.
